crops.name: Maize (Corn)
crops.description: The most important cereal crop in sub-Saharan Africa. Requires good water drainage and proper spacing.

preparation.title: Land Selection
preparation.description: Choose well-drained loamy soil with pH 5.5-7.0
tips: Previous crop should not be maize to break pest cycles
preparation.successIndicator: Fine tilth soil ready for planting

preparation.title: Soil Preparation
preparation.description: Prepare fine tilth soil for optimal seed germination
preparation.successIndicator: Soil crumbles easily with good aeration

planting.title: Planting
planting.description: Plant at optimal spacing and depth

growth.title: Germination
tips: Thin to 2 plants per hill at 2 weeks

growth.title: Vegetative Stage
growth.successIndicator: Healthy dark green leaves, vigorous growth

growth.title: Grain Filling
tips: Monitor for storage pests in field
Watch for bird damage near edges
growth.successIndicator: Well-filled cobs with hard, dented kernels

maturity.title: Physiological Maturity
tips: Black layer formation at kernel tip

harvest.title: Harvesting
tips: Harvest when kernels dent and harden

postHarvest.title: Drying
postHarvest.description: Reduce moisture to safe storage levels
tips: Use clean drying mats or concrete floor
Turn grain every 2-3 hours in sun
Cover at night to prevent re-wetting

postHarvest.title: Storage
tips: Use hermetic bags (PICS) for long storage

crops.name: Wheat
crops.description: Major cereal crop for bread making. Thrives in cool climates with well-distributed rainfall.

crops.name: Rice
crops.description: Major food crop requiring flooded conditions or heavy rainfall.

postHarvest.title: Milling
tips: Store polished rice in airtight containers

requirements.soilType: Clay loam soils with good water retention

crops.name: Beans
crops.description: Important protein source and nitrogen-fixing crop. Intercrop with maize.

harvest.title: Harvesting
tips: For dry beans, harvest when pods yellow

crops.name: Tomatoes
crops.description: High-value vegetable crop with good returns. Requires staking and intensive management.

growth.title: Flowering
tips: Apply calcium to prevent blossom end rot

crops.name: Potatoes
crops.description: Important food and cash crop. Requires cool temperatures and well-drained soils.

crops.name: Onions
crops.description: High-value bulb crop with good storage life. Requires well-drained soils.

crops.name: Cabbage
crops.description: Cool season vegetable with high yields. Popular in fresh markets.

crops.name: Carrots
crops.description: Root vegetable rich in vitamin A. Requires deep, loose soils.

crops.name: Peas
crops.description: Cool season legume with nitrogen-fixing ability. Quick returns.

crops.name: Coffee Arabica
crops.description: High-value cash crop requiring specific microclimates, often grown on highlands.

preparation.title: Site Selection
preparation.description: Choose high altitude with well-drained volcanic soils

planting.title: Nursery Establishment
planting.successIndicator: 20-30cm tall seedlings with 6-8 pairs of leaves

planting.title: Transplanting
tips: Plant at start of long rains

growth.title: Pruning & Training
growth.description: Establish single stem or multiple stem system
growth.successIndicator: Balanced frame with good bearing wood

postHarvest.title: Processing
tips: Dry process: Sun dry whole cherry

yield.quality: Grade AA beans with blue-green color
